title: Potato Broccoli Cheddar Soup
directions: In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Add butter, potatoes, onions, and broccoli stems. Sautee for 5-10 minutes until onions turn golden brown.
Add broth, milk, salt, and pepper. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer until the vegetables are almost tender, about 10 minutes.

In a food processor or blender, pulse the soup to a coarse puree. Return the soup to the pot and bring to a simmer. Add the broccoli florets and simmer until they are tender, about 5 minutes. Stir 1/4 cup of shredded cheddar cheese into the soup, and serve the soup topped with the remaining cheese. Sprinkle bacon bits on top.
ingredients: 1 3/4 pounds broccoli, thick stems diced (about 2 cups), tops cut into small florets (about 1 quart)
2 pieces bacon, fried and diced (for garnish)
